description:
NTS Map: 082N08Lake O'Hara circuit is a 2.8 km loop that hugs the lake. You'll cross several foot bridges and a waterfall. Lake Oesa is a 6.4 return climb from Lake O'Hara. Lake O'Hara is a beautiful lake that you must view for yourself. The trail up to Lake Oesa is a work of art by Lawrence Grassi. Stepping stones galore, and scenery to die for. You'll pass several lakes and a rock slide before reaching Lake Oesa. Once at Lake Oesa, you have the option of returning the same way or taking the Yukness Ledge Alpine Route back to Lake O'Hara. The trailhead for Lake Oesa starts 0.8 km into the left side of the Lake O'Hara trail.  

In winter please check the Avaluator
(Online Trip Planner) rating is: 
 Simple.  
See more trip planner route details here.
directions:
11 km west of Lake Louise. You must take a 11 km bus ride which you have to reserve. Call (250) 343-6433 for more info.

Note - This trail is NOT in Alberta, No part of YOHO park is Alberta, it's in BC. This trail location was input incorrectly. Nearest city is Field, B.C. or Lake Louise, AB.
title: Lake O'Hara and Lake Oesa
